Ingress Intel Total Conversion Mobile

Build version: ${build_version}
IITC version: ${iitc_version}

by ${cradle_link}, ${fkloft_link} and contributors

Icon by ${giuseppe_lucido_link}

IITC Mobile is an optimized mobile browser for the Ingress Intel Total Conversion (IITC) userscript.

Community:

• Visit the ${website_link} for new releases and the desktop version.
• Follow the ${tg_iitc_news_link} Telegram channel for announcements and join ${tg_iitc_group_link} chat.
• Join the ${reddit_iitc_link} Reddit community - a place to ask for help and discuss with other users.
• Report issues and propose enhancements at ${bugtracker_link}.

Developers:

${github_iitc_link} on Github.

IITC Licence:

${ISC_license_text}

How to use IITCm:

• Navigation: swipe from the left edge of your screen (or click the app icon) to evoke the Navigation Drawer.
Click the app icon again to return to the map.
• Layers/Highlights: swipe from the right edge of your screen (or click the layer-chooser icon in the ActionBar) to evoke the Layer Drawer.
• You can quickly send the current portal link/permalink to another device if both devices support NFC (hold both devices back-to-back and tap the screen to beam the map to the other device).
• You can add official plugins in the settings.
• For external plugins please have a look at the FAQ.

Hint: Alternative ways to open the info screen:

• tap and hold a portal for a second
• tap on the left half of the status bar

Hint:

Some plugins (e.g. portals list and bookmarks) now appear in the Navigation Drawer for quick access.

They won\'t appear in the info pane any more.

Swipe from the left edge of your screen (or click the app icon) to seem them.

Hint:

IITC Mobile is able to load external plugins too!

Add them by clicking the (+) icon at the top right. The plugin files have to end with \'.user.js\' and are copied to %1$s

With Share portal you can:

• send the portal link to other people
• view the selected portal\'s position in another app
• open the portal link in a webbrowser

Hint: By selecting Google Maps (or any other installed navigation software), you can quickly navigate to the selected portal.

These hints also apply for the permalink.
